speaker: Mr. Rakesh Verma\nPresident of Indian Aeromodellers Club (IAC) having 30 years of experience.
title: Drone Designing Workshop
description: AeroRGIT organised a Drone Designing Workshop to provide hands-on experience on designing, building and flying a drone

speaker: Ms. Vinni Shah Modani\nHead Counselor at Aara Education Consultancy, CA & CFP
title: AARA Consultancy's career guidance webinar
description: Aara Education Consultancy is Indian as well as Abroad Education Consultancy catering to various countries like USA, UK, Canada, Australia, etc. The Speaker explained about various abroad studies options available after graduation. The live session crossed 400+ views.

speaker: Mr. Kartik Patil
title: ANSYS Workshop
description:
AeroRGIT organised Ansys workshop for students of RGIT and foreign colleges aiming to provide them a good platform  for understanding simulation environment, various analysis techniques, types and enhance their analysis skills. The entries flooded with total 50 number of participants. The workshop covered topics as follows:
- Basic introduction of Ansys
- Static Structural Analysis
- Modal Analysis 
- Thermal Analysis 
- Explicit Dynamic Analysis

speaker: Ms. Nikhitha C. \nCEO, Co-founder of Society of Space Education, Research & Development (SSERD), Head of Mass Media & Communications at International Space University, Dr. Kalpana Chawla Scholar
title: Space Talk
description: The webinar organised was focused on Upcoming Space Revolution and Opportunities in Space. The Speaker unveiled the diverse opportunities available in Space domain providing in depth knowledge about history of space exploration. Also explained about current researches in this field.

speaker: Mr. Vikram D. Londhe\nCo-founder of Natskies Observatory, TEDx Speaker, Fellow of Royal Astronomical Society, associate at International Astronomical Union
title: MARS Exploration webinar
description: The webinar focused on future Mars Exploration opportunities. The session was all about giving students an information of planet Mars and envisioning about Mars Civilization. Speaker also explained the importance of reusable rockets and ideology behind it by SpaceX. He also talked about rover technologies and how one can become part of such Mars Missions being an Indian student.

speaker: Mr. Sunny Kabrawala\nCEO & Founder of STAR LABS, Space Entrepreneur, TEDx Speaker, Josh Talk Speaker
title: Webinar on Space Education & Indian Space start-ups
description: The session was all about giving students an information about the private space sectors and Indian Space start-ups. Speaker also explained about the need of such start-ups, their future scope and opportunities available for students in this sector.

speaker: Dr. Ajit Singh\nHead of International Exams at Endeavor
title: GRE & GMAT webinar
description: The session was focused on information about the GRE & GMAT Exams. Speaker shared various strategies for preparations of these exams. He also discussed about various masters programs and how Endeavor helps student providing proper guidance.

speaker: Mrs. Anima Patil-Sabale\nIndian-American NASA Scientist, Astronaut candidate, Project PoSSUM, Orion Spacecraft Simulations Lab Manager, NASA Johnson Space Center (Jacobs) xEMU Spacesuit Engineer, TEDx Speaker, HERA Mission Commander, Mars Analog Mission Commander, STEM Advocate
title: Women's Day Celebration
description: AeroRGIT was fortunate enough to have such a determined, talented, inspiring, down to earth, honest person as one of the resource person. Anima Ma'am shared her entire journey from dreaming to be an Astronaut to getting appointed as an Astronaut Candidate in NASA. She also discussed about the difficulties & challenges faced. The session was inspiring for all students having such great aspiration. The true meaning of Women's Day was delivered through this session!

speaker: Mr. Rehan Ansari
title: Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) Workshop
description:
AeroRGIT organised a two day workshop on Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD). The entries flooded with 85 number of participants. The session covered topics as follows:
- Introduction to CFD Analysis
- Simulation of flow through an open pipe
- Steady state flow simulation over an Airfoil
- Flow simulation through Convergent-Divergent Nozzle
- Aerodynamic analysis of Tesla Cybertruck

speaker: Dipti Pal & Mr. Sandeep Sharma
title: DIMS MBA Webinar
description: The session was about various career options of studying in India and studying abroad. Further MIM, deferred MBA programs were introduced.

speaker: Mr. Dhaval Kunte\nAlumnus of SPIT, MBA, NMIMS, Center Manager
title: IMS Crack the Career Code
description: The session covered a quick overview of CAT and other entrance exams for MBA with their preparation process and timeline.

speaker: Mr. Rakesh Rai\nDrone Instructor, Drone Pilot, MD - DHFL, Indian Institute Of Drone - Mumbai
title: Webinar on Drone Technology & its future scope
description: The speaker explained types of UAV's, their uses and the various purposes of drones in military field like surveying, mapping, patrolling, etc. He also explained the agenda about the importance of drone nowadays.

speaker: Various
title: World Space Week 2021
description:
Theme: Women in Space
World Space Week is an international celebration of science & technology, and their contribution to the betterment of human condition. AeroRGIT celebrated this space week to contribute a little in the awareness of this field. And thus various activities related to Aerospace field were conducted throughout the week. 

• Day 1: Space Talk 
Date: 4th October 2021
Speaker: Ms. Shweta Kulkarni
Fellow of Royal Astronomical Society - England, Director - AstronEra, CEO - Astron SHK Trust
Platform: Google Meet
The dominant focus of the session was on the role of women in astronomy. Speaker also explained about dark matter, dark energy, scope of science communicator in India. 

• Day 2: Space Quiz
Date: 5th October 2021
Platform: Round 1 - Extended Google Form
Round 2 - Quiziz
All students were given a timed form in Round 1 and selected 17 students went for next round. Round 2 was a live quiz on Quiziz platform where students competed simultaneously and top three participants were ranked. All students showed great interest. 

• Day 3: Treasure Hunt
Date: 6th October 2021
Platform: All social media handles of AeroRGIT & Aerozone
Students were given 6 hours of time to solve all the clues and reach to the end of the hunt. All participants showed great enthusiasm. The top three with the right answers were ranked.

• Day 4: Astrophotography Competition 
Date: 7th October 2021
Students showed great enthusiasm and provided with the best entries. The entries were evaluated on the basis of original work. The best three captures were selected and ranked.

• Day 5: Essay Writing Competition
Date: 8th October 2021
Topic: A day as an Astronaut in Space
Students showed great enthusiasm and provided with the best entries. The entries were evaluated on the basis of creativity, inclusion of all rules, imagination. The best three works were selected and ranked.

• Day 6: Space Talk
Date: 9th October 2021
Speaker: Mr. Siddharth Pandey
Head of Centre of Excellence in Astrobiology at Amity University, India
Platform: Google Meet
The speaker discussed about several recent, upcoming trends & developments in the Aerospace industry. He also explained about Amity Research Centre, research conducted by them and opportunities available for aspiring students. Overall the session was motivating and informative for all space enthusiasts. 

• Day 7: Poster Making Competition
Date: 10th October 2021
Topic: Women in Space
Students showed great enthusiasm and provided with the best entries. The entries were evaluated on the basis of creativity, unique idea, original work and display of proper message. The best three designs were selected and ranked.

title: Stargazing Event
description: AeroRGIT in collaboration with Native Maniacs organised a Stargazing Event at Malshej Ghat. The event went successful with 54 enthusiastic participants. The inclusions were:\nStargazing, Camping, Trekking, Travelling, Bonfire, Food, Other Activities. \nAll participants enjoyed and learnt about stars, constellations, universe, astronomy, etc. All the Covid-19 related norms were followed and precautions were taken while conducting the event. This was the amazing experience for all the participants.
